item.title: Trump and television divide CBS newsroom

item.title: Paramount CEO’s father offers $40B backing for WBD takeover
item.description: Larry Ellison’s intervention comes as competition heats up between Paramount and streaming giant Netflix to take over WBD.

item.title: What actually mattered in 2025, with Janice Min and Emily Sundberg
item.description: The Ankler’s Min and FeedMe’s founder Sundberg join Mixed Signals for a candid roundtable lookback at a disorienting year in media.

item.description: Reflections from media leaders around the world.

item.title: Audiobook growth contrasts with print

item.title: Kevin O’Leary on playing the villain and turning attention into power
item.description: Shark Tank’s Kevin O’Leary joins Mixed Signals to talk about his buzzy turn as a ruthless tycoon in Marty Supreme — and how it felt playing a fictionalized version of himself.

item.title: New anchor Dokoupil sets the tone for ‘CBS Evening News’
item.description: In his opening monologue, Tony Dokoupil lamented that his colleagues in the news business had leaned too much into the perspectives of subject matter experts.

item.description: The media veteran joins Mixed Signals for a raw, sprawling conversation about why he chose to publish an eight-part (and counting) Substack series responding to the most personal and public crisis of his career.

item.description: “On the money part, not enough,” Lizza said on Semafor’s “Mixed Signals” podcast when asked about how much money he made off of the 25,000-word series.

item.title: Pro-Trump group to air Super Bowl ad touting Trump Accounts

item.description: Applecart has a leading place in an emerging but discreet cohort of companies and organizations aimed at reaching key figures in industry and government.

item.description: Stephen Dubner has spent 20 years proving that things aren’t what they seem—and now he’s not so sure that’s always true.
